author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students learning new things and concepts on the ‘Science Express’ at Tirunelveli junction on Sunday.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

Indian Railways’ ‘Science Express’ train arrived at Tirunelveli junction on Sunday for the four-day exhibition here.

Collector M. Karunakaran formally inaugurated the exhibition and visited the coaches along with students who had come in large numbers.

The Ministry of Railways is running this eighth phase of ‘Science Exhibition’, a mobile exhibition train, in coordination with the Department of Science and Technology and the Ministry of Environment and Forests. A treasure trove of knowledge for children and elders alike, the ‘Science Express’ displays various aspects of climate change impact featuring nature conservation, recent advancements in biotechnology applications and international climate change negotiations.

After visiting 391 railway stations across the country and crossing over 1.35 lakh km ever since it was introduced, the ‘Climate Action Special Science Express’ with 16 coaches reached the fifth platform of Tirunelveli junction.

Over 1.50 crore visitors, mostly students, have gained knowledge on a range of scientific aspects, particularly on ‘Climate Change’.

The exhibition will be open from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. For more information, interested persons can visit http://www.sciencexpress.in or call 09428405407, 09428405408 or email to sciencexpress@gmail.com

The train will leave Tirunelveli on March 16 to reach Changanaseri, its next destination.
title: ‘Science Express’ reaches Tirunelveli for 4-day expo
